ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of more complex Arabic grammar and thematic vocabulary and expressions; practice at consuming authentic materials (lots of infographics and videos) and at constructing responses. The second half of Al-Kitaab 2.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not much emphasis on vocabulary or grammar

This class was great in that it gave us lots of opportunities to practice speaking and talking through issues that were interesting to us. The homework online with automatic feedback was helpful for the more mechanical aspects of language learning, and I appreciated that that was kept for us to do on our own and in-class time was reserved for what is actually valuable to do with in-class time. 

I think we could spend more time practicing grammar and expressions in class and seeing ways in which they can be helpful/useful to us in broadening the range of things we can say. Grammar mostly involved going over the homework assignments associated with the grammar, but those were relatively mechanical and I think we could be pushed more to actively use the expressions and constructions in new ways. I think that kind of targeted practice in addition to the more free-flowing general discussion in class would have been helpful. We got used to speaking in class, but I think it was easy for us to become complacent in our level of speaking and while we learned new vocab, we did not actively work that much at increasing the complexity, precision and accuracy of our speech.

Sarab was lovely, always very kind and supportive. It's very much a course where you get out what you put in. If you do all the assigned work and study regularly outside of class, your Arabic will definitely improve.

The daily homework was helpful but I felt like it should be more intentional in the future. Some exercises felt unnecessarily repetitive and simply time-consuming, without adding much in terms of learning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Sarab did a very good job instructing us in Arabic, especially conversationally.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student interested in improving their Arabic.
Yes, if you want to improve or maintain your Arabic level, this is a good option.
Arabic is a great language to know, so I'd absolutely recommend, and this class is a big stepstone on that learning journey.
